Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of satyr and maenad; upper torso and extended left arm of satyr, to right, with fawn-skin with brown dots around neck; torso of meanad in overgirt peplos with wreath embroidered on it and a brown girdle, bending forward to right and probably resting her left foot on raised ground, her right arm (mostly lost) extended.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd joins Oxford G737 (2), which gives some of the lower part of both figures. The sherd may belong to same vase as Oxford G738.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0213) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 124, pl. LXVII, no. 13)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
